meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be knowledgeable or well-informed, especially in a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The sciolist claimed to know everything about astronomy, but couldn't even name the planets.
meanings.sent2: She realized he was a sciolist when he started talking about medicine but couldn't even pronounce 'pharmaceutical'.
meanings.sent3: The sciolist confidently explained the theory of relativity using only emojis.
meanings.sent4: His performance as a sciolist in the history debate was like a magician pulling facts out of a hat.
meanings.sent5: The sciolist's facade of expertise crumbled when asked to explain basic algebra.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be knowledgeable or well-informed about a subject.
meanings.sent1: She would often sciolist her way through conversations about politics, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent2: He decided to sciolist about cars to impress his friends, but they quickly saw through his act.
meanings.sent3: The comedian sciolisted about quantum physics in his stand-up routine, much to the confusion of the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to sciolist about art history was like painting a masterpiece with words.
meanings.sent5: The politician tried to sciolist his way out of the scandal, but the truth eventually came to light.
